content.description: The start is on a block that looks like a face in a Picasso painting. Must climb the zig zag crack all the way to the top. No other holds allowed, crack only.
content.location: If you are driving north on Monmouth Street, right before you approach 6th st there is an alley way with some grass on your left. Walk to the end of the orange building and look at the wall to find the crack and Picasso.

content.description: sustained and pumpy like most climbs in this area.  no distinct crux but only 2 good rests to chalk up.  starts on decent sized ledge and traverses right to all the way to the corner of coles and 6th.
content.protection: pads not necessary. landing is grassy but watch out for dog poop and other things the grass may hide.
content.location: from corner of coles and 6th, walk up the street (against traffic direction) about 25 feet from the corner before the mossier patches of rock.start well before the small mulberry tree growing between the sidewalk and wall.  you should be across the street from the large parking lot. no specific start hold.

content.description: THIS ROUTE HAS BEEN DESTROYED BY THE INSTALLATION OF CITY BIKES
content.location: directly across the street from charlie dont surf. start at ally and traverse to corner of 6th and coles, kitty-corner from the church

content.description: link up of the jumping jack flash and gawker traverse (backwards). THIS ROUTE HAS BEEN DESTROYED BY THE INSTALLATION OF CITY BIKES
content.location: route starts 25 feet up 6th street from the corner of coles and 6th( same start as route formerly known as mousecop)

content.description: begin traverse on corner and make moderate/easy moves for about 10 feet. crux is blank blocks with no cracks.  climb up then left using reachy ledges, ridiculously shallow pockets and a thin crimpy edge. second crux is less strenous but also tricky.  1 resting block between the 2 hard problems
content.protection: pads are optional but optimal setup has 1 pad with person moving pad or 2 pads under 1st and second crux. falls are onto cement sidewalk.
content.location: route starts on corner on Coles st and 6th directly across 6th street from the church. start on granite corner and traverse left (granite blocks) on the coles street side.

content.description: traverse left to right starting with smoother white granite and moving right, toward darker, easier blocks. white blocks are much harder and more techy, grey blocks are just pumpy.
content.protection: A pad or 2 is helpful for the crux but might be unnecessary with different beta.
content.location: start at the corner of 6th and coles, just past the bushes on coles st. traverse in the direction of 5th st and the alley, moving from light to dark rock.

content.description: very unique because of its location in the middle of downtown jersey city. rock is literally stone blocks built into a 25 foot vertical wall. blocks a are varied and irregular creating crimps, 2 finger sloping pockets, cracks (where grout has fallen out) and large slopers. rock quality ranges from high quality granite blocks (primarily on Coles, Mommouth and Jersey ave) to chossy sandstone with incredible sticky pockets. routes, as of now are all bouldering traverses though they can stretch for upwards of 50ft. Be prepared for strange looks from people
